Package com.github.tommyettinger.digital

package com.github.tommyettinger.digital
All code for digital is in this package, including number-text conversions, array and unary hashing, GWT compatibility code, tools for arrays, trigonometry, polyhedra, and general math.
  • Class
    Description
    AlternateRandom
    A drop-in replacement for Random that adds few new APIs, but is faster, has better statistical quality, and has a guaranteed longer minimum period (also called cycle length).
    ArrayTools
    Static methods for various frequently-used operations on 1D and 2D arrays.
    Base
    Provides ways to encode digits in different base systems, or radixes, and decode numbers written in those bases.
    BitConversion
    Methods for converting floats to and from ints, as well as doubles to and from longs and ints.
    Distributor
    Different methods for distributing input long or double values from a given domain into specific distributions, such as the normal distribution.
    Hasher
    64-bit and 32-bit hashing functions that we can rely on staying the same cross-platform.
    Hasher.HashFunction<T>
    A functional interface type for 32-bit hash() functions that take one item, typically of an array type.
    Hasher.HashFunction64<T>
    A functional interface type for 64-bit hash64() functions that take one item, typically of an array type.
    Hasher.SeededHashFunction<T>
    A functional interface type for 32-bit hash() functions that take a long seed and one item, typically of an array type.
    Hasher.SeededHashFunction64<T>
    A functional interface type for 64-bit hash64() functions that take a long seed and one item, typically of an array type.
    Interpolations
    Provides predefined Interpolations.Interpolator constants and ways to generate Interpolations.InterpolationFunction instances, as well as acting as the registry for known Interpolator values so that they can be looked up by name.
    Interpolations.InterpolationFunction
    A type of function that takes a float from 0 to 1 (usually, and also usually inclusive) and returns a float that is typically in the 0 to 1 range or just outside it.
    Interpolations.Interpolator
    A simple wrapper around an Interpolations.InterpolationFunction so it is associated with a String Interpolations.Interpolator.tag.
    MathTools
    Mathematical operations not provided by java.lang.Math.
    RoughMath
    Fast approximations of math methods that reach roughly the right answer most of the time.
    ShapeTools
    Static data for the 3D platonic solids.
    Stringf
    A limited polyfill for String.format() where the platform doesn't provide it, such as on GWT or TeaVM.
    TextTools
    Various methods for searching, joining, splitting, replacing, counting, and padding String and sometimes CharSequence items.
    TrigTools
    Trigonometric approximations for sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2(), with variants for most that allow users to trade speed for precision or vice versa.
